result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay the DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements by the end of probationary period.  Court ordered monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on Extended Supervision.  If not paid, will convert to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No controlled substances or alcohol.
No physical discipline of his daughter.
Defendant not to possess anything that looks, shapes or acts like a firearm.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens to ensure compliance.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine E.L. Gray III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Count 1.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $696.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/28/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 02/01/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in court with Attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Sentencing.  Speaking for Defendant:  Jazzman G.  After colloquy with the Court and Defendant, the Court could not move forward with sentencing due to some of the answers Defendant gave.  Matter is adjourned for a status hearing on November 9, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Due to the Court not being available, the matter is adjourned to October 16, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for sentencing.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Sentencing.  The Court adjourned the matter due to the Court currently in trial.  Matter is adjourned to October 9, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Received and filed:  
Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs.
Paperwork forwarded to Sandy Cottrill in Room 104.
cab

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, court ordered the repeater enhancer dismissed.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was not ordered. Case adjourned for sentencing.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered the currently calendared final pre-trial for 9/30/15 and jury trial for 10/19/15 vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray not in court, in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  cab
 Status conference held.  
SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Defense counsel is asking for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also in court is Attorney Douglas Bihler who has the defendant's other case, 15cm2856 (file not in court)
cab
The parties are here for the state's motion to join.
Court heard arguments of the parties.  Both defense counsel are objecting to the joining of these cases.
Court denied the state's motion for joinder.
The court adjourned this case to allow the Public Defender's Office to determine which attorney will be appointed to the defendant's cases.
Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 36.
  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Defendant's Response to State's Motion for Joinder.
cab

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The court was informed that this case was scheduled for a motion for joinder.  
Received and filed:
Notice of Motion and Motion for Joinder.
The defense was informed that they have until 08/17/2015 to file a reply brief, if they intend to.
Attorney Douglas Bihler is the attorney on the other case that the state is asking to be joined, 15CF2856, which is set for a scheduling conference in Branch 30.  Both counsel will be objecting to the motion.  Attorney Bihler is out of the office today.

Case adjourned in Branch 36 for a motion hearing.
  Motion hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray NOT in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at request of Branch 36. Matter set for Jury Trial on 8/10/2015. Branch 36 no in session on that date. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date. State advised court of new pending case for this defendant. Court modified the Final Pretrial date of 8/4/2015 from a Final Pretrial date to a Motion Hearing date.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Danilo Cardnes.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine E.L. Gray in court PRO SE.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Dan Meylink, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing date in branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
